summary: The Internal Revenue Service must keep its computer systems secure to protect financial and taxpayer data. Every year since FY 1997, we have assessed whether the IRS had effective controls in place to safeguard this information. During this year’s audit, we identified new and continuing deficiencies in information system security controls. These deficiencies affect IRS’s ability to help ensure systems are operating securely. These risks...
title: Management Report: Improvements Are Needed to Enhance the Internal Revenue Service's Information System Security Controls
